Description: Terracotta squatting naked female figure. A naked fat female being seated on a rough plinth, with her legs bent and her vulva emphasized. Her hair is parted in the centre and falls in locks in front of her shoulders. She wears a tightly woven and bound wreath. With her left hand she holds a pot to her left side and inserts her right hand into its flaring mouth. The back is plain, with a circular depression for a vent that was not pierced. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt; traces of a black pitch-like substance adhere to the surface.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Bibliog. Franks n.d.: M 62.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3141)
Condition: Left foot is broken away and the plinth has some damage.
